Key Match Events: Heinrich Klaasen monstered five sixes in a 27-ball 52
Hardik Pandya, Arshdeep Singh and Jasprit Bumrah delivered for their captain in the final over
Suryakumar Yadav pulled off a clutch catch in the deep to dismiss David Miller
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma’s men celebrated on the outfield after closing out a seven-run victory
South Africa tipped into favourites status when Heinrich Klaasen monstered five sixes in a 27-ball 52
Kohli raced out of the traps before throttling back after the fall of three powerplay wickets
Ravi Shastri delivered his best Michael Buffer impression at the toss
Shastri promoted the left-hander Shivam Dube in his final match as India head coach
Post-Match Reflections: Sharma said, 'I’m proud of the boys. It was fantastic for the fans to support us through New York to Barbados. They have been waiting a long time, just like us.'
Kohli said, 'I’ve seen him play for so many years but even I don’t know how he does it.'
Both Sharma and Kohli announced their retirement from T20 internationals in the aftermath
Aiden Markram, the impressive South Africa captain, said, 'It’s just gut-wrenching. That’s really what it is.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: India won by seven runs in a nail-biting final
This was India's second T20 World Cup victory, with the first being in 2007
South Africa's search for absolution continues as they lost their first men's global final
Virat Kohli scored 76 in 59 balls in the first innings
Shivam Dube added 27 in 16 balls in the first innings
Axar Patel was run out by Quinton de Kock's lasered throw from wicketkeeper
Ravi Shastri delivered his best Michael Buffer impression at the toss
